Enlarging an Area of the Chart

Note: The Zoom button is available on the Windows client Chart Window Toolbar only. You can zoom in and out on a chart in the Cross-Platform client by holding down CTRL and the left mouse button and moving the mouse left and right. Moving the mouse left makes the chart smaller and moving the mouse right makes the chart larger.

To see an area of your chart in more detail, you can enlarge it by using the Zoom button on the Windows client Chart window toolbar.

To enlarge an area of the chart:

  1. Click the Zoom button on the Chart window toolbar.

  2. Next, click an area of the chart where clicking does not serve any other function (for example, in a pie chart, click the background or the depth of a slice). This action displays a magnifying glass cursor.

  3. Drag the cursor to an area to enlarge it.

  4. To go back to the original version of the chart, click the Zoom button again.

In a pie or doughnut chart, you can also move a slice away from the center of the chart to give it greater emphasis. This action is called exploding.

To explode a slice from a chart:

Click a slice and drag it away from the pie or doughnut at the center of the chart. The chart resizes itself to accommodate the distance between the slice and the pie.
